1.title: Giver's Building Ontario!
1.plot: Ontario Playground The Giver kids set out to make a playground that pays homage to Ontario's biggest cities. Here we find a playground structure which is inspired by Parliament Hill under construction and a tire swing designed to look like scaffolding.

2.title: Giver's Building Quebec!
2.plot: Quebec Playground Our Quebec playground pays tribute to Canada's Fur Trading history. Here we find a wooden fur trade canoe see saw, a log cabin fur trading post and a rope climbing structure inspired by the forest.

3.title: Giver's Building Nova Scotia and New Brunswick!
3.plot: Nova Scotia and New Brunswick Playground Drawing on Nova Scotia and New Brunswick's incredible nautical history, the Giver kids set out to make a playground inspired by its ocean surroundings. A giant Lighthouse slide, an accessible sailboat sandbox, and a net climber inspired by anchors and fishing.

4.title: Giver's Building Manitoba!
4.plot: Manitoba Playground Manitoba's playground is inspired by Canada's agriculture roots. The Giver kids built an impressive 2 level barn structure with hay bale monkey bars and a slide. They also build a corral of horses and a super chicken.

5.title: Giver's Building North West Territories and Yukon!
5.plot: North West Territories and Yukon Playground The Giver kids build a playground that pays homage to the Klondike Gold Rush. They build a massive mining tunnel play structure with a rock quarry seating area, a mining pan swing and mining cart spring carts.

6.title: Giver's Building British Columbia and Prince Edward Island!
6.plot: BC and PEI Playgrounds Drawing on Canada's coastal provinces, the Giver kids build a giant interconnecting Totem Pole play structure to honour BC's Indigenous People and a mural inspired by the Rockies. In our PEI playground, the Giver kids build a giant whale climber and a mural painted with potatoes.

7.title: Giver's Building Alberta and Saskatchewan!
7.plot: Alberta and Saskatchewan Playground The Giver kids build a playground that is influenced by the West's "Wild" history. Here they build Canada's Wild West complete with a 2 level western town play structure with ladders and a giant swing set and a fun prairie wagon climber with a slide.

8.title: Giver's Building Newfoundland and Labrador!
8.plot: Newfoundland and Labrador Playground In our Newfoundland and Labrador playground, the Giver kids set out to make a playground inspired by the province's first European settlers, the Vikings. Here we find a playground inspired by a Viking settlement complete with a Viking hut playhouse and a Viking Ship with a slide.

9.title: Giver's Building Nunavut!
9.plot: Nunavut Playground In our "cool" Nunavut Playground, the Giver team build a towering igloo climber with ropes and a swinging seat, an iceberg spinner and an Inuksuk slide.

10.title: Giver's Celebrating Canada!
10.plot: Canada 150 Episode The entire Giver series culminates with the grand opening of the entire Giver playground in celebration of Canada 150. The Giver team of kids from all over Canada tell us about the experience of designing and building this incredible park and what their hopes are for the future. Happy Birthday Canada.

1.title: Batawa: Dinosaur Park
1.plot: Batawa - The Giver team travels back in time to build a prehistoric dinosaur themed playground with local kids in Batawa, Ontario.

2.title: Fergus: Dog Park
2.plot: Fergus - Giver's gone to the dogs. The team travels to Centre Wellington to the town of Fergus, Ontario to build a dog playground with local kids - and their dogs.

3.title: Guelph: Circus Park
3.plot: Giver heads to Guelph, Ontario to refurbish an old playground into a circus themed spectacle.

4.title: Hamilton: Future Park
4.plot: Hamilton (Future Park) - There's only one thing the Giver team wants in the future for this community in Hamilton, Ontario -- a new park. Together they construct a futuristic playground to enjoy for years to come.

5.title: Newmarket: Car Park
5.plot: Newmarket - The York Region Children's Aid Society in Newmarket, Ontario needs a place where parents and children can learn to play together again. Good thing the Giver team is here to build a car themed playground in the parking lot.

6.title: Goderich: Butterfly Park
6.plot: Goderich - Every year, thousands of monarch butterflies fly to Goderich, Ontario. Unfortunately, not many people know about it! In this episode, the Giver team works together to make a monarch park to celebrate the butterfly migration.

7.title: Niagara Falls: Pirate Park
7.plot: Niagara Falls - The Giver team arrives in Niagara Falls, Ontario to create a much needed playground, inspired by the Maid of the Mist... until pirates take over.

8.title: Hamilton: Science Park
8.plot: Hamilton (Science Park) - Hamilton, Ontario is a centre of many scientific discoveries. Together, the Giver team discovers that by working with the community they can build a science themed playground in just three days.

9.title: Hawkesville: Sandbox Park
9.plot: Hawkesville - Giver's in Hawkesville, Ontario to make a playground with this community full of volunteers. Everybody lends a hand to make Ontario's largest sandbox in this beach themed park.

10.title: Etobicoke: Nature Park
10.plot: Etobicoke (Toronto) - Giver arrives to a park in Toronto, Ontario badly in need of help. Together they work with local kids to celebrate the bugs in their playground.

11.title: South Gower: Obstacle Park
11.plot: Giver's off to South Gower, Ontario to turn a pathway between two sports fields into the ultimate race course.

12.title: Kemptville: Skate Park
12.plot: Kemptville - Kemptville, Ontario is a town full of skaters, with a skate park that doesn't quite stack up. The Giver team hops on their skateboards to create an amazing skate park for the community -- including a concrete half pipe.

13.title: Georgina Island: Chipewa Park
13.plot: Georgina Island - Giver travels to Georgina Island, Ontario to create a natural playground, and celebrate Aboriginal culture.

1.title: I Love Toronto Park
1.plot: The Giver team meets a group of kids and builds a mini city playground in tribute to their city, the largest city in Canada - Toronto, Ontario.

2.title: Music Park
2.plot: Music has always been important to the city of Sarnia, Ontario, and the Giver team works hard to make it a noted theme in this brand new musical playground!

3.title: Giant Park
3.plot: The Sleeping Giant is a famous landmark in Thunder Bay, Ontario - but where does he play when he wakes up? The Giver team works with the community to build a park fit for a Giant!

4.title: Camp Park
4.plot: The Giver team packs their sleeping bags and heads to Parry Sound, Ontario to build the ultimate camp playground at the Ontario Camp of the Deaf!

5.title: Boat Park
5.plot: Ahoy! The Giver team sets sail on constructing a brand new boat themed playground for the community of Chippawa in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

6.title: Gnome Park
6.plot: Knowing that gnomes are good luck for farmers, everybody lends a hand to create a unique park for gnomes in the farming community of Linwood, Ontario!

7.title: World Park
7.plot: Toronto, Ontario is one of the most diverse cities in the world! To celebrate, the Giver team builds a playground celebrating the world in a city!

8.title: Trail Park
8.plot: Ganaraska Trail School in Port Hope has a wonderful trail name, but there's no trail at the school, and even worse- no playground! The Giver team works with the entire school to bring the trail back with an impressive forest playground!

9.title: Sawmill Park
9.plot: The farming community of Monkton only has one playground, but it's old and rundown. The Giver team works with the town to create a perfect farm themed playground!

10.title: Farm Park
10.plot: The farming community of Monkton only has one playground, but it's old and rundown. The Giver team works with the town to create a perfect farm themed playground!

1.title: Train Park
1.plot: When a flood causes Strathroy-Caradoc to relocate its miniature railroad, Giver lays down the track for a brand new train themed playground to go along with it.

2.title: Firefighter Park
2.plot: The firefighters in Victoria Harbour in the Township of Tay come to the rescue to help build a brand new fire truck themed playground next to their station.

3.title: Carnival Park
3.plot: The Cambridge Giver Team works to build a carnival themed playground that kids and seniors will enjoy together.

4.title: Treehouse Park
4.plot: Giver travels to Algonquin Highlands to build a tree house themed playground to match all the trees surrounding this lake front park.

5.title: Cheese Park
5.plot: The community of Ingersoll gets cheesy when tasked with the challenge of building a cheese themed playground to celebrate the history of cheese in their town.

6.title: T-Rex Park
6.plot: Giver teams up with the community of Rexdale in Toronto to make an epic T-Rex themed playground.

7.title: Alphabet Park
7.plot: The community of Emsdale teams up with Giver to create a new alphabet themed playground next to the library.

8.title: Sports Park
8.plot: The community of Amherstburg works together to create an inclusive sports themed playground at the local recreation centre that will be fun for all.

9.title: Pizza Park
9.plot: Giver heads to Leamington and works with the community to create a massive pizza playground.

10.title: Hammer Park
10.plot: The community of Hamilton gets out their hammers to build a hammer-themed playground, celebrating their city's nickname.

imdb.title: Giver

production companies.name: Bell Broadcast and New Media Fund

plot: Kids work with their community to improve playground spaces.
synopsis: Giver is a series about kids working with their community to improve their playground spaces. The kid teams must decide on a theme, what to keep, what to scrap, and they only have 3 days to do it! Fortunately, the kids arent alone. Host Michael, along with community volunteers, work with the kids to see that their playground vision is brought to life.Giver does what no other show does it engages children in Ontario to give back and get active with their communities! Season I of the show features the design and building process of thirteen different playgrounds from a build at City Housing Hamilton serving children whose nearest playground was a half hour walk away, a First Nations playground on the reserve of the Chippewas of Georgina Island, and a playground for York Region Childrens Aid Giver realizes that every playground has a unique story reflecting the community that surrounds it. Giver is the show that keeps on giving empowering children across the province to believe that they have the power to change the communities they live in, for the better.
